title: Electronic Communications 1st 2014 Beasley txtbk + solutions ISM
description:
Electronic Communications: A Systems Approach, 1st Edition (c2014), textbook + instructor solutions manual (ISM) by Jeffrey S. Beasley, Jonathan D. Hymer & Gary M. Miller.

TEXTBOOK INFO: <a href=" http://www.pearsonhighered.com/educator/product/9780132988636.page" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.pearsonhighered.com/educator/product/9780132988636.page</a>
(ISBN-13: 9780132988636 txtbk ; 9780133514278 ISM)

AUDIENCE: Electronics & electricity technologists: Ã‚Â«...intended for a one- or two-semester course sequence in electronic communications, wireless communications, communications maintenance technology, or introductory telecommunications. The text is suitable for students in two-year programs at community colleges or technical institutes as well as for students in some four-year programs in electronics engineering technology or industrial technology. Math analysis has been kept to the level of algebra and trigonometry [no calculus] but is sufficient to enhance understanding of key, underlying concepts.Ã‚Â»

BRIEF CONTENTS:
--------------
1. Fundamental Communications Concepts
2. Amplitude Modulation
3. Angle Modulation
4. Communications Circuits
5. Transmitters
6. Receivers
7. Digital Communications Techniques
8. Digital Modulation and Demodulation
9. Telephone Networks
10. Wireless Communications Systems
11. Computer Communication and the Internet
12. Transmission Lines
13. Wave Propagation
14. Antennas
15. Waveguides and Radar
16. Fiber Optics
Appendix: FCC General Radiotelephone Operator License (GROL) Requirements

FILE INFO: paginated, bookmarked, true PDF (with apparent downsampling of some raster objects in the ISM). Files zipped together in a single .7z file. To unzip and "convert" to PDF, *right-click* the downloaded file (.7z) & choose *Extract* in the contextual menu; discard the .7z file (container) when done with seeding
